title: 111_hr6033
content: The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability Act of 2010" consolidates education tax incentives into a Higher Education Tax Credit under Section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Higher Education Affordability Act of 2010 consolidates education tax incentives into a Higher Education Tax Credit under Section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This credit allows individuals to claim up to $3,000 of higher education expenses paid for each eligible student per taxable year, with a lifetime limit of $15,000 per student. The tax credit for higher education expenses is subject to a credit limitation based on modified adjusted gross income. The tax credit for higher education expenses is subject to a limitation based on the amount of tax. The credit allowed for the taxable year cannot exceed the sum of the regular tax liability plus the tax imposed by section 55, minus the credits allowable under this subpart and section 27.
